issue.title: Add `.fromCache` property to the stream API

comment.body:
I would name it `.isFromCache`.

Is there any point in making it `undefined` before the `request` event? Can't we just make it `false` then?

issue.title: force stdout to use UTF-8 encoding
issue.body:
Ensure tasklist output is in UTF-8 format, otherwise tasks with windowTitles containing UTF-8 chars will be rendered as � instead.

E.g. A task with windowTitle
"how to open new window · Issue #401 · SimulatedGREG/electron-vue - Google Chrome" 
would register as 
"how to open new window � Issue #401 � SimulatedGREG/electron-vue - Google Chrome" 
in the tasklist output instead, if stdout wasn't specified to use the UTF-8 charset

comment.body:
I really doubt this is the proper way to fix it. I would look for a better solution without having to use the shell.

// @MarkTiedemann In case you know something about this.

issue.title: Added flag for the language
issue.body: Allow to pass the language from the command. Defaults to English.

comment.body: You also need to update the readme.

issue.title: Issue 651: Incorrect filename displayed after export
issue.body: When using the save to file service, the filename is placed in the context target path. Using that to display under export list - rather than using the generated default one.

comment.body: You should use `path` methods instead of regex to modify the path.

issue.title: Added flag for the language
issue.body: Allow to pass the language from the command. Defaults to English.

comment.body: The flag should be `—language` and the default value should be set in the meow options.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -157,6 +157,9 @@ Note:
 - If the API accepts an options-object, define an `Options` interface as seen above. Document default option values using the [`@default` tag](http://usejsdoc.org/tags-default.html) (since interfaces cannot have default values). If the default needs to be a description instead of a basic value, use the formatting `Default: Lorem Ipsum.`.
 - Use `@returns`, not `@return`.
 - Ambient declarations can't have default parameters, so in the case of a default method parameter, document it in the parameter docs instead, as seen in the above example.
+- When you have to use node types install the node types as a dev dependency and add the `/// <reference types="node"/>` triple-slash reference to the top of the file.
+- When you have to use DOM types (`Window`, `Document`, ...) add the `/// <reference lib="dom"/>` triple-slash reference to the top of the file.
+- Third-party library types must be installed as direct dependencies, if required. They usually only require a triple-slash reference when they expose interfaces only in the global namespace. Otherwise prefer imports over triple-slash references.
comment.body: These are in the wrong section. They should be in the https://github.com/sindresorhus/typescript-definition-style-guide#checklist section.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,3 +186,5 @@ Note:
 
 - The test file should be named `index.test-d.ts`.
 - `tsd` supports top-level `await`.
+- When testing promise-returning functions don't use the `await` keyword. Instead, assert directly for a `Promise` like in the example above. When you use `await` your function can potentially return a bare value without being wrapped in a `Promise`, `await` will happily accept non-`Promise` values and your test is rendered meaningless.
+- Use [`const` assertions](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/What's-new-in-TypeScript#const-assertions) when you need to pass literal or readonly typed values to functions in your tests.
comment.body: I didn't mean this specifically for testing. I meant it for the type definitions themselves.

issue.title: package.json engines.node when using object rest/spread syntax
issue.body:
I wasn't sure where to ask so this seemed like a reasonable place.  What do you feel is an appropriate value for engines.node in a package which uses object rest/spread syntax?

```js
this.options = {
  ...defaultOptions,
  ...options
};
```

This feature was introduced in node.js 8.3.0 by the upgrade of v8 to 6.0.  LTS started at 8.9.0.  So when `engines.node` is set to `>=8` this is technically incorrect.  Sorry I didn't notice this before posting patches to `make-dir` and a couple others.

Refs:
[node.js 8.3.0 changelog](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/doc/changelogs/CHANGELOG_V8.md#8.3.0)
[v8 6.0 release](https://v8.dev/blog/v8-release-60#object-rest%2Fspread-properties)

comment.body: IMHO, it's expected that people upgrade patch versions of Node.js. Node.js point versions outside LTS are also technically considered unsupported when the major version goes into LTS.

pull_request.title: fix: should work with Node.js 8.0.0
pull_request.body:
The spread syntax is not supported in Node.js 8.0.0
though the package claims to support Node.js>=8

comment.body: IMHO, it's expected that people upgrade patch versions. But we can continue this discussion in https://github.com/sindresorhus/meta/issues/8.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +153,7 @@ Note:
 - If the parameter description just repeats the parameter name, leave it out.
 - If the parameter is `options` it doesn't need a description.
 - If the function returns `void` or a wrapped `void` like `Promise<void>`, leave out `@returns`.
-- If you include an `@example`, there should be a newline above it. There also needs be a newline after the `@example` tag because of [this TypeScript bug](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/15749).
+- If you include an `@example`, there should be a newline above it. The example itself should be wrapped with triple ticks (```` ``` ````).
comment.body:
```suggestion
- If you include an `@example`, there should be a newline above it. The example itself should be wrapped with triple backticks (```` ``` ````).
```
